reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent 2 nights at this hotel and very much enjoyed our stay. We chose them after reading reviews here on TA and made the right decision.
reviews.title: Very nice and we'll come again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The rooms are typically Parisien, aka on the small side, but who cares? You're in Paris and should be outside. The room was nicely decorated, very clean and the bathroom was equally clean with a wonderful shower. The location is great, not too touristy but walking distance from Notre Dame and many other sites, plus the always convenient metro nearby.
reviews.title: The Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain was a fantastic place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The staff were all friendly and helpful and while we chose not to have breakfast there (cafes right outside for less money), we were told that the breakfast was very nice.
reviews.title: Very Enjoyable Stay

likes.liked: — Great location, room was comfortable and I slept well.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, we were quite pleased and do plan on staying here again during our next trip to Paris. The price was also not too high.
reviews.title: Great small historic hotel, minutes from the Notre Dame.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My colleague and I went to Paris for 4 days to attend a conference. We stayed at the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The hotel has a restaurant/bar downstairs and is conveniently located in the lively and diverse Quartier Latin. Tons of restaurants, shops and cafes abound and the metro is paces away from the hotel. I will definitely pay the Hotel Abbatial Saint Germain another visit, hopefully soon!
reviews.title: Ideal location, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paris was the last stop on our trip following up Amsterdam & Brussels. The Abbatial Saint Germain was a breath of fresh air. Through we did splurge from our normal, budget hotel rates, this hotel was still reasonably priced, located close to lots of wonderful sight seeing. In addition, directly our our street-side, private balcony was a view of the Panteon, and around the corner was Notre Dame. In the mornings, there is a fresh market down the street as well.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay, Accomidating Staff & Wonderful View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff was very accommodating even arranging transportation for us to the airport. Though the elevator is (as mentioned by other reviews) very small, we opted to use the stairs more often than not, and left the elevator for those who needed it most. I would defiantly recommend Abbatial Saint Germain to a friend.
reviews.title: Stop researching and stay here!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel as part of our honeymoon and we really enjoyed it. Rooms are clean, comfortable and the bathroom was quite spacious. We had the best nights sleep in their big comfy beds!There is a lift which is on the small size but my husband and I managed to squeeze ourselves, 2 suitcases and 2 hand luggage. The reception staff are very helpful and they organised an airport transfer for us to Orly so we wouldn't have to navigate the metro with lots of luggage. We didn't have the breakfast as it was a bit pricey. We walked up the street to an unbelievable patisserie - La Parisienne. So affordable, we paid less than 5 euros for both of us to have breakfast (croissants, croque monsieur etc). Its a block and a half up the road. The hotel is unbelievably close to Notre Dame - take a shortcut up one of the streets to save you time. The metro is very close too. All in all, we had a great honeymoon and we would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Nice atmosphere, great location, good value, friendly caring staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend it. I stayed 5 nights, and found Abbatial a comfortable, secure, affordable home. The staff treat you like a great friend who has come to stay--they offer concierge services. I tried the 12-euro breakfast only once: croissants, etc and coffee are great but also cereal, canned fruit cocktail and fake-seeming scrambled eggs. Very clean, warm, lots of towels, excellent discreet maid service.
reviews.title: What a lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Arrived in CDG and took the train to St Michel Notre Dame. The hotel is only 10 mins from the station. Upon entering the room we were pleasantly suprised with the size of the room as we had read about the small sizes of rooms in Paris hotels. The room had a lovely bed(two singles joined well together), exposed wooden beams and a balcony overlooking the Bvld St Germain. Traffic noise was no problem as the windows were double glazed. Location was prefect. Very close to Notre Dame and to a number of Metro stops. Would recommend the hotel to anybody. Did not have brekfast in the hotels so can not comment on this
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was pleased overall with the hotel. Rooms are very small however this is to be expected in Paris, the bed was nice and comfortable and the room was clean. There was however only one towel in our room when we arrived so requested more and we were given one more towel. The following moring, in the middle of my morning shower the water turned cold which can be quite annoying when you have a head full of shampoo. A call to reception fixed the problem and it didn't happen again. Location was also good, plenty of cafes and restaurants nearby. Overall experience was pleasant.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel but tiny rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what a great surprise it was. i traveled to Paris with my partner, for a romantic vacation, we booked abbatial hotel after reading some good reviews here, and walking into the room was so good! the room was spacious, very clean, staff at the desk were very nice every time we needed something or had questions, the location is simply amazing! just 10 minutes walk from the Notre-dame cathedral, a metro station close by, and so many restaurants, bistro's, food and wine shops, and whatever it is that you need/want.
reviews.title: what a lovely surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we had a reservation for the bath-tab- room, and it is very much recommanded.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a GREAT location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: i would'nt choose any other hotel on my next trip to Paris!
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Stayed at the Hotel Abbatial for 5 nights recently (12/12-12/17) ~ room 32 (with 2 very small but very cute balconies). Excellant location, 3 blocks from Notre Dame and Isle d' Saint Louis. Restaurants, shopping, wine/cheese shops and bakeries are very close by. The hotel was VERY clean and the staff was friendly and helpful (especially Veronique!!). The only drawback is that it is a bit noisy in the rooms (could hear plumbing and TV from other rooms). Would DEFINITELY stay here again!!
reviews.title: Great little hotel, great location, great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located and clean. Has a good breakfast with lovely croissants and a kind woman to help guests. The service personal are polite and kind. My room problem was the boulevard trafic noise that we could heard at night. I suggest windows noise proof.
reviews.title: Nice place to enjoy Paris
Cool little place
reviews.text: This little hotel is in a cool location close to a lot of action and Metro stations. The rooms are a little tight, the beds small but tolerable. The elevator can accommodate two people with suitcases and that's it. If you can't do the stairs and are claustrophobic, get a room on a lower floor. It's clean and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I'd stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were quite pleased with our stay in the Abbatial. The location is excellent: Notre Dame is a 3 minute walk away, there is a metro station and a taxi stand. Restaurants nearby (one on each side of the hotel, numerous others in the neighborhood. Ile Saint Louis is also very close. The staff was always very helpful.
reviews.title: Hotel Abbatial is great!
Great Location, Nice Hotel
reviews.text: Perfectly nice hotel, clean rooms, good price, and great location.

reviews.title: Very cozy Hotel in a great area
reviews.text: The Hotel was very cozy, very pleasant. The room was very nice and very cute, very Parisian. The area is amazing... If we came to Paris again, we'd certainly come to this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: First, the location....could not have been better. Minutes from major sites. Hotel is on major street in Paris full of life and traffic. Front desk staff was so helpful, especially the man at night. After traveling from the US, we arrived early in the morning. The staff allowed us to leave our luggage in a waiting room and to use the wireless internet even thou we had not checked in. They kept us aprised of our room and as soon as it was ready they let us check in. I have to say, traveling all over Europe, I was prepared for a small room...tho nothing this small! The room truly could not have been more than 11X11. That said, it was clean and comfortable. We struggled with luggage placement but with some carefully organized planning, the room worked. We were in room #51, which was the smallest on the floor it appeared. No real extras here, but again...the location! Be sure to try a restaurant around the corner called Le Petit Pontoise. Exit the hotel, go to the left one block, make another left. It's right there an can't be missed!! Excellent staff who make Americans feel welcome! Another great place is Eric Kayser for fresh pastry. I hit this place every morning!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back to the hotel. There is a small refridgerator in the room that is stocked, I emptied it out and went across the street to a small market for soda, water and snacks. The refridgerators are not real cold, so you need to keep things in there for a while for them to become chilled. For some reason, in Europe nothing is cold and they do not believe in ice! In fact, I think they enjoy saying "no" when you ask for extra, more, or even some!!!
reviews.title: Stay here when you visit Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TV in each room, hair dryer, etc. Cleaning lady was very nice, be sure to tip on your first few days so they remember you!!!
reviews.title: Great location and quirky hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stay at this place if you want to be near the Latin Quarter and a very nice part of Paris. Very close to the Metro, which you must use!!! Easy to get around Paris on the Metro.
reviews.title: Clean & well-situated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again!!
reviews.title: Good value, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great little hotel close to a lot of great landmarks. The people at the front desk were wonderful and the rooms are really clean and modern. Only complaint is that the beds are TINY... and if you come back to the hotel past like 12 they lock the front door and you have to ring the bell 50x before the sleeping man at the front desk wakes up to let you in:)
reviews.title: Great location, really friendly and helpful staff and clean rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here in 2009 and promise we would return again and yes we did.
reviews.title: Beyond our Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011
reviews.text: The improvements are fantastic. Bedrooms now have a De luxe room which we took and it is well worth the extra euro. Large room queen sized bed, fridge , safe , tea /coffee making facilities, wi fi, the bathroom was bigger than some of the rooms we had stayed in other hotels.
reviews.title: Great position and friendly helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Excellent breakfeast, superb staff, spotless in every respect. Thank you Veronique for a fantastic time with you.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a terrific location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One small point : whilst there is wi fi throughout , there is no internet facility available , and there are no internet cafes in the area.
reviews.title: Great Parisian Hotel on the Left Bank

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I don't understand where these other people stayed. It could not have been this hotel. The staff was nice but very unhelpful. The room we had was very very small ,but with the good view of paris came the traffic. The traffic on Saint Germain sounded like a nascar event. The only time it was quiet was 4 am to 6 am. Worst stay my life
reviews.title: Terrible hotel- Bring Ear Plugs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I were due to stay at this hotel the first weekend in September – It was a surprise for my wife as it was our first wedding anniversary. I did confirm shortly after booking approx 2 months ago and received a confirmation e-mail I also sent an email the Thursdays before travelling – no reply received and when we arrived on Saturday afternoon we were told they had issues with some rooms and we had no room in the hotel – but we were booked into another hotel two arrondissements over – i.e. in 7. They did pay for a taxi to the other hotel however it was not in as good a tourist location – they did state they may have a room the next night for us after phone calls were made to management but as we were just going to be in town for a weekend we decided not to move back. Hotel Vaneau was OK I have also written a review – overall I found this a poor experience in that I had planned to stay in this area and had planned our trip accordingly.
reviews.title: A review of a Hotel I did not get a chance to stay in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: I only ever had one experience of this before in Barcelona where rooms were being modified and when I arrived they apologised upgraded and moved us to a 4 Star hotel across the plaza – we were offered no upgrade or reimbursement here.
reviews.title: Ok, but nothing more...

likes.disliked: — The noise and the lack of hot water in the shower

reviews.title: A good stay, with one problem
reviews.text: Would I stay here again – who knows did not even stay this time!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room clearly above normal parisian standard for this class of hotel, but service is non-existent and the same goes for hot water in the shower.
reviews.title: Good hotel, but beware 4ft double bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Being located in the very heart of the city, I didn't have to spend time and money on public transport.
reviews.title: very central, absolutely positive

likes.disliked: — the internet connection was not stable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bedroom & bathroom were comfortable and adequate.
reviews.title: Great location, very cute hotel
Loved this hotel next to Latin Quarter
reviews.text: Minibar, safe deposit box in room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The internet connection could be a bit more stable..
reviews.title: A great find.
A happy time in Paris
reviews.text: It was grrrreeeeeat! Clean rooms, breakfasts like at grandma's home, excellent service (thanks to Marco and the nice lady at the reception we forgot to ask her name...). Location - perfect! In Latin Quarter, 5 mins from Notre Dame, 1 min from Metro.
